title: Fix multibackend loading and terminal bottom panel menu
Extend mobile-server with session/workspace APIs
description: Extend src/main/mobile-server.ts to expose: GET /api/sessions?path=X&backend=Y (discover sessions), GET /api/workspace (get workspace), POST /api/workspace (save workspace), GET /api/settings (get settings), POST /api/settings (save settings), POST /api/project/add (add project dialog). These mirror the Electron IPC methods.

title: Extend mobile-server with full PTY/terminal APIs
description: Extend src/main/mobile-server.ts to expose: POST /api/pty/spawn (spawn PTY, return ptyId), POST /api/pty/:id/write (write to PTY), DELETE /api/pty/:id (kill PTY), WebSocket /api/pty/:id/stream (stream PTY data bidirectionally). Must handle authentication, track active PTYs, and clean up on disconnect.

title: Create API provider and update App.tsx
description: Create src/renderer/api/index.ts that exports a singleton API instance. On load, detect environment: if window.electronAPI exists use ElectronBackend, otherwise use HttpBackend. Create React context ApiProvider if needed. Update App.tsx to import from api instead of using window.electronAPI directly. Remove the MobileApp early return - use the full app with the appropriate backend.

title: Create API abstraction interface
description: Create src/renderer/api/types.ts with TypeScript interface that mirrors window.electronAPI. This interface will be implemented by both Electron IPC and HTTP/WebSocket backends. Include all methods: spawnPty, killPty, writePty, onPtyData, discoverSessions, getWorkspace, saveWorkspace, getSettings, saveSettings, addProject, ttsInstallInstructions, onApiOpenSession, onPtyRecreated, etc.

title: Create Electron IPC backend for API layer
description: Create src/renderer/api/electron-backend.ts that implements the API interface by wrapping window.electronAPI calls. This is a thin wrapper that delegates to the existing Electron IPC. Should handle cases where electronAPI is not available gracefully.

title: Create HTTP/WebSocket backend for API layer
description: Create src/renderer/api/http-backend.ts that implements the API interface using HTTP and WebSocket calls to the desktop server. PTY data streams over WebSocket. Other calls use HTTP REST endpoints. Must handle connection state, reconnection, and authentication with bearer token. Server URL comes from stored host config.
